metatags.og:title: #assam #entrepreneurship #entrepreneurs | Vasudev Murthy
metatags.og:description:
I had a great time interacting  with high school students of The Assam Valley School  set in beautiful tea estates near Tezpur, Assam. 

We had fun creating entrepreneurial experiences through simulations.  Romance books publishing, organic ice cream, plastic waste recycling, Assam handicrafts ‚Ä¶ the students had a blast figuring out the nuances of their business and arriving at how much they needed to start!

The North East has so much talent! And the people are polite and gracious! I can‚Äôt wait to be back!

#assam #entrepreneurship #entrepreneurs 

Pooja Kaur Sailaja Prasad Mohanty Anju Jayraj

metatags.twitter:title: #startupindia #assam #entrepreneurship #empowerment #quickghy #trade‚Ä¶ | Gaurav Medhi
metatags.og:title: #startupindia #assam #entrepreneurship #empowerment #quickghy #trade‚Ä¶ | Gaurav Medhi
metatags.og:description:
Hi, I‚Äôm Gaurav Medhi. Coming from a business background, I‚Äôve faced my share of challenges, particularly after losing my father at a young age. My mother‚Äôs resilience held our family business together, but joining the management later exposed me to the harsh realities of business, especially in Assam. Facing backbiting, mental health struggles, and countless obstacles, I managed to overcome them with the support of my mother and sister.

These experiences have fueled my mission with QuickGhy, a service-based startup focused on empowering the blue-collar workforce and actively contributing to the growth of our nation. Working in Assam's business ecosystem for over 15 years, I‚Äôve witnessed an unfortunate trend: people often prioritize monetary gain at any cost, and collaboration is scarce. As a result, businesses and resources here are controlled by outsiders, creating a gap that I aim to bridge.

As startups gain attention, more ecosystem enablers are emerging in Assam. While this is a promising st

metatags.twitter:title: Let's promote and developed a new generation businessman for Assam in agro‚Ä¶ | Manash Chaliha | 29 comments
metatags.og:title: Let's promote and developed a new generation businessman for Assam in agro‚Ä¶ | Manash Chaliha | 29 comments
metatags.og:description:
Let's promote and developed a new generation businessman for Assam in agro based commodity .
When we passes through wholesale mandi in Market place of Assam, Most of the Assamese young people put an remark that " all of our market place is occupied by the outsider " 
To looking into, this years old remarks and disappointment by the people of Assam, we come up with an new business policy and concept , Local business for local people in collaboration with business community .
The way forward is :
1. Setting up a new business relationship with old trader's of  potatoes and onion , by emphasizing in more trustworthy and transparent delivery of potatoes and onion to the wholesaler mandi from Nasik, alowar, Agra, Jalandhar etc . Using mobile app 
2. Aggregating young  and educated people for localized distribution of onion and potatoes at the wholesale prices , which will reduce the cost and of the small retailer as they don't need to travel to the distance market mandi and our youth also lear

items.title: #resilience #communityfirst #grit #sustenance #brahmaputra ...
items.snippet: Oct 25, 2024 ... Lessons from the Banks of Brahmaputra The past few days have been a testament to the unyielding spirit of Assam and its people.
items.htmlSnippet: Oct 25, 2024 ... Lessons from the Banks of Brahmaputra The past few days have been a testament to the unyielding spirit of Assam and its people.

metatags.twitter:title: #resilience #communityfirst #grit #sustenance #brahmaputra #assam‚Ä¶ | Rakhi Kashyap
metatags.og:title: #resilience #communityfirst #grit #sustenance #brahmaputra #assam‚Ä¶ | Rakhi Kashyap
metatags.og:description:
Lessons from the Banks of Brahmaputra

The past few days have been a testament to the unyielding spirit of Assam and its people. As the mighty Brahmaputra river continues to nourish and challenge the region, I've witnessed:

Resilience: Communities adapting to the unpredictable waters.
Patience: Officials working tirelessly to mitigate flood impacts.
Grit: Local heroes going above and beyond to support each other.
Sustenance: The unwavering determination to rebuild and thrive.

The people of Assam have shown me that:

Adversity can fuel strength
Community is key
Resilience is a way of life

As we navigate life's challenges, let's draw inspiration from the Brahmaputra's unrelenting flow and the people who call it home.

#Resilience #CommunityFirst #Grit #Sustenance #Brahmaputra #Assam #Inspiration #LessonsLearned

metatags.og:description:
JADAV PAYENG ‚Äì the name is enough to invoke reverence in every person irrespective of his/her field of expertise. Who could tell from his humble disposition that the man is an epitome of compassionate leadership! He took things in stride and invested 30 years of his life to transform a hitherto barren sandbar of the Brahmaputra, covering an area of 550 hectares of land, into a man-made forest. Today, the forest Molai Kathoni in the Jorhat district of Assam is a thriving habitat of tigers, elephants, deer, rabbits and a wide diversity of native and migratory species. And now, the Forest Man of India is all set to repeat the history ‚Äì this time in Mexico. The Padma Bhushan Awardee has been invited to collaborate on environmental projects in Mexico with an aim to plant 7 million trees in the country. Towards the end, the Mexican government has granted him Visa for the next 10 years.

Payeng might not represent a typical entrepreneur. But for his indomitable drive to solve a pressing problem, his unfazed resi

metatags.twitter:title:
‚û°Ô∏è Getting featured at Startup Times as Assam's young entrepreneur


When‚Ä¶ | Niharika Bora
metatags.og:title:
‚û°Ô∏è Getting featured at Startup Times as Assam's young entrepreneur


When‚Ä¶ | Niharika Bora
metatags.og:description:
‚û°Ô∏è Getting featured at Startup Times as Assam's young entrepreneur


When I started my professional journey (it started with a telecalling job), I had zero idea about professionalism. But still, I was generating a good amount of leads for the company I was working for because I had good communication and networking skills. But when Kotak Mahindra Bank got banned by RBI, a side of my professional journey ended.



I worked for a startup for some months. Plot twist : I got scammed. Not only me, but an entire team. We didn't get paid at all after working full time. Reason? I got extremely sick at the day of an event. The amount of disrespect I got from that incident somehow gaslighted me into thinking "Am I the unprofessional one as they say?"



But then, I started working on The Ambition Hub again. I rebuilt my organization. I also built a trustworthy team. Most importantly, I'm proud of myself that I've never ever disrespected or deceived my employees. There is a thin line betwee
metatags.twitter:description:

I worked for a startup for some months. Plot twist : I got scammed. Not only me, but an entire team. We didn't get paid at all after working full time. Reason? I got extremely sick at the day of an event. The amount of disrespect I got from that incident somehow gaslighted me into thinking "Am I the unprofessional one as they say?"



But then, I started working on The Ambition Hub again. I rebuilt my organization. I also built a trustworthy team. Most importantly, I'm proud of myself that I've never ever disrespected or deceived my employees. There is a thin line betwee

metatags.og:title: #msme #empower #entrepreneurs #digitization #msmedevelopment #rampprogram‚Ä¶ | Dr. Ravi Kota, IAS | 24 comments
metatags.og:description:
Chaired the State RAMP (Raising and Accelerating #MSME Performance) Programme Committee meeting to review and finalize the action plan for implementing this flagship initiative across Assam. RAMP is program of Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of India 

The deliberations underscored the shared commitment of all stakeholders to fortify Assam‚Äôs MSME ecosystem. Approved a structured and inclusive roadmap to #empower #entrepreneurs, enhance resilience, and address the unique challenges faced by MSMEs in our state.

Key outcomes of the meeting:

Comprehensive MSME Development: The action plan focuses on sector-specific support to ensure equitable benefits for MSMEs of all scales and types under the program.

Capacity Building and Awareness: Tailored training modules and awareness campaigns will equip MSME stakeholders with the skills and insights needed to leverage the RAMP program effectively.

Advancing #Digitization: Emphasis on digital adoption will enhance efficiency, expand marke
